github.lightningcreations.lcjei.wrapper

Class WrappedEngine<GuestGameType,HostGameType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • github.lightningcreations.lcjei.wrapper.WrappedEngine<GuestGameType,HostGameType>
  • Type Parameters:
    GuestGameType - The type of the Game used by the Guest Engine.
    HostGameType - The type of the Game used by the Host Engine.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEngineInterface<WrappedGame<GuestGameType,HostGameType>>, Runnable

    public final class WrappedEngine<GuestGameType,HostGameType>
extends Object
implements IEngineInterface<WrappedGame<GuestGameType,HostGameType>>
    Represents a Engine that can be used to insert a Game belonging to a different Engine, called the Guest Engine, into a Host Engine.
    Most methods are forwarded to the Guest, possible gathering resources from the host.
    Author:
    chorm

    • Constructor Summary

      Contracts a new Wrapped Engine with a given guest engine, host engine, and host game.

      void destroy()
      Finalizes the engine and destroys any implementation created frame.
      Container getCurrentDrawContainer()
      Obtains a container, that when drawn to, draws to the same pane as the Engine is currently drawing to.
      If the engine was initialized with a call to IEngineInterface.initialize(Container) for a non-null Container c, and that call returned true, then Container returns c or a child of c.

      Gets the internal game object.
      void initialize()
      Initializes the guest to draw to the host's current draw container as though by {initialize(Container).
      boolean initialize(Container c)
      Initializes the Engine referenced by this Interface.
      The Engine is requested, though not strictly required, to render the graphical output to Component.
      If c is null, has the same effect as IEngineInterface.initialize().
      This may not be called after a call to initialize, unless a subsequent call to destroy has been made.
      void run()
      Executes the game.
      This method MUST only be called between succesful calls of initialize and destroy.

                     IEngineInterface<HostGameType> host,

        Contracts a new Wrapped Engine with a given guest engine, host engine, and host game.
        Parameters:
        guest - The Interface to the Guest Engine.
        host - The Interface to the Host Engine.
        hostGame - The Host Game that is wrapping/embedding the Guest Game.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public boolean initialize(Container c)
                   throws IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: IEngineInterface
        Initializes the Engine referenced by this Interface.
        The Engine is requested, though not strictly required, to render the graphical output to Component.
        If c is null, has the same effect as IEngineInterface.initialize().
        This may not be called after a call to initialize, unless a subsequent call to destroy has been made. If this method is called in violation of this requirement, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        After this call, the engine MUST be in an Initialized State unless this method threw an exception
        It must be possible to draw to c, and c MUST be visible or an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface IEngineInterface<WrappedGame<GuestGameType,HostGameType>>
        Parameters:
        c - The container to draw to. This parameter may be ignored and may be null. If ignored or null, false is returned, and the results are identical to IEngineInterface.initialize().
        Returns:
        true iff c is not null, and the implementation initializes the state to draw to c.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the Engine has already been initialized and not yet destroyed.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws IllegalStateException
        Initializes the guest to draw to the host's current draw container as though by {initialize(Container).
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface IEngineInterface<WrappedGame<GuestGameType,HostGameType>>
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the Engine has already been initialized and not yet destroyed

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
             throws IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: IEngineInterface
        Finalizes the engine and destroys any implementation created frame.
        If the engine is drawing to a user supplied Container passed via IEngineInterface.initialize(Container), this container is not freed or cleared.
        This method may only be called after a call to any initialize that succesfully returns, but not after a call to destroy that succesfully returns which is not followed by a such a call to initialized. Attempting to call this method in violation of this contract causes a IllegalStateException. After this call, the engine shall be in an uninitialized state and can be discarded or reused.
        The results of garbage collecting an EngineInterface object that refers to an engine that has been initialized but not destroyed are undefined.
        Specified by:
        destroy in interface IEngineInterface<WrappedGame<GuestGameType,HostGameType>>
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the Engine has not yet been initialized or has been destroyed without being reinitialized

      • run

        public void run()
         throws IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: IEngineInterface
        Executes the game.
        This method MUST only be called between succesful calls of initialize and destroy.
        Specified by:
        run in interface IEngineInterface<WrappedGame<GuestGameType,HostGameType>>
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the method is called before the Engine is initialized, or after it is destroyed but before it has been reininitialized.

      • getCurrentDrawContainer

        public Container getCurrentDrawContainer()
        Description copied from interface: IEngineInterface
        Obtains a container, that when drawn to, draws to the same pane as the Engine is currently drawing to.
        If the engine was initialized with a call to IEngineInterface.initialize(Container) for a non-null Container c, and that call returned true, then Container returns c or a child of c.
        Otherwise the result is unspecified. Such a container is invalidated by a call to IEngineInterface.destroy(), and use of that object passed that point has undefined results.
        This method MUST be called between successful calls of initialize and destroy. Calling this method in violation of this contract causes a IllegalStateException to be thrown.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentDrawContainer in interface IEngineInterface<WrappedGame<GuestGameType,HostGameType>>

      • getGameObject

        public WrappedGame<GuestGameType,HostGameType> getGameObject()
        Description copied from interface: IEngineInterface
        Gets the internal game object.
        The result of this method is unspecified.
        Unlike other methods, this can be called at any time.
        Specified by:
        getGameObject in interface IEngineInterface<WrappedGame<GuestGameType,HostGameType>>
